text: That is not a very good attitude. I will keep my eye on you.

text: From my circular desk where I can see everything. Tiny swivel.

text: See how it works?

text: What about my office and its many walls?
speaker: A

text: That becomes a new public waiting room. And we got rid of that giant pillar that was in front of your door.

speaker: A

text: Well, get over it, because it's gone. You're going to be more accessible than ever.

text: Excuse me.

text: There's a sign at Rampset Park that says do not drink the sprinkler water. So I made some tea with it, and now I have an infection.

text: Okay, you did not just swivel away while I was talking to you.

text: Donna, you know as well as I do, these city manager shakeups always peter out. We just have to wait.

text: Usually, I'm with you. But this is Chris Traeger.

text: Ron Swanson.
speaker: B

text: Chris, you have come up with a plan so spectacularly horrible that it might ruin the entire department.
speaker: A

text: Now, wait a minute.
speaker: B

text: No, I mean that as a compliment. So it pains me to say this.
speaker: A

text: My department has to go back to the way it was.
speaker: A

text: Give them time. They'll adjust.
speaker: B

text: No, they won't. They're miserable.
speaker: A

text: Tom only performs when there's someone to impress. So marooning him on Freak Island isn't helping anyone.
speaker: A

text: And you made April assistant to everyone?
speaker: A

text: You know who April hates? Everyone.
speaker: A

text: And Jerry can only function if no one's looking. You shine a light on him and he shrinks up faster than an Eskimo scrotum.
speaker: A

text: Well, that's very perceptive, Ron. And very graphic.

text: I understand your point. But there's no way that I can just roll over on this.

text: Mmhh, okay.

text: You won't ever hear me say this again, so savor this moment.
